You are responsible for calling this method after committing all command buffers that contain commands targeting this drawable, and before calling [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable/present()], [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable/present(at:)], or [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable/present(afterMinimumDuration:)].

# signalDrawable(_:)

**Instance Method**

Schedules a signal operation on the command queue to indicate when rendering to a Metal drawable is complete.

## Declaration

```swift
func signalDrawable(_ drawable: any MTLDrawable)
```

## Parameters

- **drawable**: [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable] instance to signal.

## Discussion

Signaling when rendering to a [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable] instance is complete indicates that it’s safe to present it to the display.

You are responsible for calling this method after committing all command buffers that contain commands targeting this drawable, and before calling [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable/present()], [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable/present(at:)], or [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLDrawable/present(afterMinimumDuration:)].



Metal doesn’t guarantee that command buffers you commit to the command queue after calling this method execute before presentation.
